caption: Since February 2024 is working again! Every hour the Defender of Time is fighting against one of the randomly selected animal: the crab, the rooster or the dragon (representing sea, sky and earth). Each spectacle  starts with 3 strokes, then we can hear the sounds of a chosen element.  At noon, 6 pm, and 10pm, all three animals attack at the same time. If you want to see and hear it properly, choose noon rather - there’s a bistro opposite the clock and could be busy (and noisy!).

On my very first visit to Paris 23 years ago, I visited this clock and watched it in motion. I could never remember the name nor where it was until finally I found it on my most recent visit to Paris. So exciting! Unfortunately, despite restoration efforts it no longer works. Still, I was happy to share this nostalgia and personal history with my family.

It's in an out-of-the-way corner of Paris, so unless your goal is to hunt for those little known items that add flavor to a trip, I wouldn't spend a lot of time looking for it. But the sculpture is fantastic, in my opinion. I just wish it were still a functional automaton.

An extravagant and original clock in the middle of a residential buildings court. It's worth a visit if you are in the area but unfortunately it's not been maintained in a long time and it doesn't work anymore
I wish I could see the statue moving on the every hour
Cool piece of street art if you are looking for interesting local things to do. You have to find down an alley way.
I have to confirm suddenly, no move at 12:00 :(
It’s been refurbished and is fully working!  Video of all animals in motion here: youtu .be/N7oL3jRLUGk
Close by Centre  Pompidou you'll find this remarkable piece of art. The dragon and the defender, anticipating battle, high above the street,  in an area full of popular cafes. Don't miss it!

This hidden gem is actually a piece of mechanical art with short but interesting history and even shorter life. Commissioned in 1975 by a private company it was inaugurated in 1979 by Jacques Chirac - Mayor of Paris at this time. The automated mechanism was designed to put in motion a set of figures - a man with sword and a shield fighting randomly a bird, a dragon and a crab (air, earth and water) thus defending time. At noon, 6pm and 10pm all tree animals attack at the same time. This scene was accompanied by sounds of breaking waves, rumbling earth or the sound of wind, depending on the animal chosen. Too bad the installation doesn't work since 2003 due to lack of funding for maintenance.

Well worth a look if you happen to be in the area.  Otherwise there is little to no reason to pay it a visit, since it's not exactly in the most turistic area.  Sadly it's not working, because otherwise it would have been way more interesting.
Worth a visit if you're in the area. Centre Pompidou is just around the corner alongside many shops and alike.
It’s amazing and I think not enough people know it’s there
I really enjoyed it when I was a child. Unfortunately it doesn't exist anymore
Nothing soectacular but it is nice to stop for few seconds and go somewhere else
It's no longer here as of today.
The clockwork has been repaired and is full of motion again.
Broken and covered in bird poop. But it was neat to see.
Hidden and simply beautiful.
Too bad they do not invest to fix it again...
Very cool and a little bit spooky
Clock seems to be broken, not running.
Truly overwhelming

O TIME SUSPEND YOUR FIGHT:  If you are in the Paris City Hall area or near the Pompidou Center, go and admire this splendid automaton clock which comes alive from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. and which was recently restored to working order at 8 rue Bernard de Claveaux. When I went there, it was 2 p.m. and at that time, I saw a valiant fighter fighting against a belligerent dragon. The animation is random, this courageous warrior would have just as easily taken out his sword and his shield and slain the bird or the crab also present in the middle of the sound of wind and waves in the background... And if you go there at noon, 6 p.m. or 10 p.m., it's a fight with these 4 entities simultaneously that you will witness... Now, do you understand why this district is called L'Horloge? ;)
I pass there from time to time, and nice surprise this time, at 11 a.m., it came alive. I recommend stopping by, beautiful work

Very impressive clock in the courtyard. You have to search a bit, but once you're in the courtyard/passage of the complex, you'll find them pretty quickly. At the top of the hour the figures move. (But it's worth it in other ways too.)

The clock measures 4m in height, and weighs a ton. This includes, next to the spherical dial, a soldier with a sword and a shield in each hand, defending the clock against three creatures: a crab, a bird and a dragon. The three animals represent the sky, fire and the sea. Every hour, between 9 a.m. and 10 p.m., the soldier took turns fighting one of the three creatures. On the other hand, at 12 p.m., 6 p.m. and 10 p.m., the three creatures attacked him simultaneously.

This is an old clock located in the passage of an apartment building in the Horloge district. Unfortunately, the golden man doesn't perform anything. I would like to get treatment, but the treatment will probably cost money. Although it does not move, it is a wonderful piece of work that has a tremendous sense of life. I'm so fascinated by it that I can stare at it for a long time, but my neck gets tired because I have to look up. I'm sure if you moved, you wouldn't feel so tired...

The defender of time, the automaton clock after an absence of 20 years due to its condition and the city's refusal to restore it. The clock measures 4 m in height and weighs a ton, it includes next to the spherical dial, a man with a sword and a shield in each hand, defending the clock against three creatures, a crab, a bird and a dragon these three animals represent the sky, fire and the sea. Every hour the soldier fought one of the three creatures in turn, however at 12 p.m., 6 p.m. and 10 p.m. the three creatures attacked him simultaneously. Created by Jacques Monestier with the help of artists Louis Destouches for the dragon scales and Alain Mairod for the steel structure. Inaugurated on 08/10/79 by the mayor of Paris J.Chirac. Cyprien Gaillard completely restored it to make it the major piece of his exhibition.  The work was installed in its original place on 02/06/2023, it is thus back in operation and breathes new life into the clock district, 8 rue Bernard de Clairvaux Paris 3rd.
Definitely worth a detour. The clock starts operating at regular intervals.
What a magnificent and peaceful place in the heart of Paris. It's as if time stops in the clock district.

Beautiful clock, I only give 4 stars unfortunately because it no longer works. It's such a shame. When we find ourselves in front of this masterpiece we would really like to see it in action! Everything is detailed in the greatest detail... it's incredible!
The clock works, at the stroke of every hour it makes movements, the dragon breathes and the crab moves while the man brandishes his sword to defend time
It's a pleasure to go there when the hour strikes and the sculpture comes to life which had been stopped for too long

It was recently repaired and can now finally come to life every hour! If you are in the area, it’s a really nice event for young and old and for once in Paris it’s free! So why not take advantage of it?!?

Finally ! The defender of time's clock has been reassembled in its original place and it is functional again: it comes to life every hour. It's been 20 years since I waited for its return in an 'animated' version in this place.
Doesn't always work! it's a shame

I love this statue! Firstly, she is very beautiful and secondly, all the symbolism of the Defender of Time who fights with different animals is fascinating. On YouTube you can find a video of the time it was working!
